vectors.name: Foreign / potential PFE counterparty
vectors.description: Counterparty is foreign-organized or could qualify as a prohibited foreign entity; requires reps/covenants and termination rights.

vectors.name: Material assistance / supply-chain dependence
vectors.description: Contract structure allows or requires sourcing, services, IP, or data flows that could be treated as 'material assistance' from a prohibited foreign entity (depending on statutory tests and guidance).
trigger_signals: operator sole discretion sourcing from global supply chain
data hosted outside U.S.; owner lacks raw access

vectors.name: Operational control + weak step-in
vectors.description: Operator retains day-to-day dispatch/configuration control; owner cannot step in effectively (especially due to IP restrictions).
trigger_signals: step-in limited to insolvency; no IP license

vectors.name: Data sovereignty and auditability failure
vectors.description: Operator owns operational data and can store offshore; owner lacks raw access—undermines diligence and compliance proofs.
trigger_signals: owner has reports only; no raw access
